channel.title: Huddle
channel.description: Your first read on Capitol Hill politics and policy.

item.title: Shutdown hinges on razor-thin rule vote
item.description: House Republican leaders are facing a white-knuckle vote this morning as they move to end the partial shutdown after four days.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Zachary Warmbrodt
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Zachary Warmbrodt

item.title: Mike Johnson’s shutdown gamble
item.description: House GOP leaders face an uphill battle to pass the revamped government funding package from the Senate, potentially dragging out the shutdown.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Zachary Warmbrodt
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Zachary Warmbrodt

item.title: Senate shutdown deal hits a Graham snag
item.description: A partial shutdown of multiple federal agencies is a little over 19 hours away as the Senate deals with a Lindsey Graham-sized snag and House Republicans face pressure from President Donald Trump to expedite whatever the other chamber sends their way.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Senators march into a doomed funding vote
item.description: Senators widely expect the six-bill funding package to fail to advance today, almost certainly guaranteeing a partial shutdown come 12:01 a.m. Saturday.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor, Benjamin Guggenheim and Victoria Guida
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor, Benjamin Guggenheim and Victoria Guida

item.title: Shutdown threat weighs on Senate lunches
item.description: Senate Republicans and Democrats will head into separate lunches today for their first in-person conference meetings on how to avoid a partial shutdown at the end of the week.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: No shutdown deal in sight
item.description: Senators are scrambling to avoid a partial government shutdown later this week after Saturday's fatal shooting of Alex Pretti by a federal agent has members of both parties debating what guardrails they can place on President Donald Trump’s immigration enforcement agenda.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Shutdown odds spike after Minnesota killing
item.description: The killing of Alex Pretti at the hands of federal agents is hitting hard on Capitol Hill, ratcheting up the odds of a partial government shutdown and spurring Republican lawmakers to make another break with the Trump administration.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Winter storm threatens Senate funding week
item.description: Senators are facing the potential for a weather-shortened week as they sprint to pass the final six government funding bills — and leaders from both parties may need to do some arm-twisting to avoid a partial shutdown come Jan. 31.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Jack Smith speaks
item.description: It’s the televised showdown both Republicans and Democrats have long wanted: Former DOJ special counsel Jack Smith takes the hot seat in front of House Judiciary Thursday morning.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Lawmakers nearly at the funding finish line
item.description: Congress is on track to avoid another shutdown, but it needs to clear several hurdles in a short amount of time in order to beat its month-end deadline.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Movement on a health plan, but not Trump’s
item.description: Lawmakers are eyeing a health care deal this week, but it’s far from the “Great Healthcare Plan” that President Donald Trump outlined last Thursday.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy and Calen Razor
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy and Calen Razor

item.title: Funding crunch threatens House recess
item.description: House GOP leaders are racing to finish their remaining spending bills ahead of an end-of-month government shutdown deadline — and they may have to cancel the coming recess to get it done.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: A crypto titan flexes in the Senate
item.description: Tim Scott is facing a crypto calamity.
item.dc:creator: By Jasper Goodman, Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Jasper Goodman, Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: More floor meltdowns threaten funding bills
item.description: House GOP leaders are losing control of the floor to non-stop intraparty revolts ahead of the rapidly approaching deadline to avoid another shutdown.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Powell probe stiffens GOP spines
item.description: The Justice Department’s move to investigate Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is shaping up to be one of the Trump administration’s most unpopular actions yet among Capitol Hill Republicans.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Trump tests GOP with Fed probe
item.description: President Donald Trump is once again forcing a tough fealty test on GOP lawmakers — this time over the fate of the Federal Reserve and Chair Jerome Powell.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: GOP pushes back on Trump
item.description: Donald Trump’s grip on congressional Republicans is slipping.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: GOP heads into a Trump loyalty test
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: The House GOP’s nervewracking return
item.description: The start of the second session of the 119th Congress isn’t going as planned for House Republicans.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Trump huddles with House GOP
item.description: House Republicans will hear directly from President Donald Trump today for the first time since the administration’s extraordinary capture of Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy and Calen Razor
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy and Calen Razor

item.title: Congress confronts Venezuela fallout
item.description: Venezuela will dominate the congressional agenda this week, with Republicans lacking a unified vision on what happens next after the capture of Nicolás Maduro and the Senate poised to vote to limit further attacks without lawmaker approval.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Zachary Warmbrodt
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Zachary Warmbrodt

item.title: Inside the GOP fight over reconciliation 2.0
item.description: Republicans face a nasty showdown in early 2026 over whether to take another swing at a party-line policy bill ahead of the midterms.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: This GOP trio is a thorn in Thune’s side
item.description: One year into John Thune’s stint as majority leader, a conservative trio has been causing many of his biggest headaches.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Six weeks to avoid a shutdown
item.description: Congress is in danger of needing to pass another short-term funding patch — or risk triggering another government shutdown — if lawmakers fail to quickly reach a funding deal once they return from the holidays.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: House Dems keep thwarting the GOP
item.description: House Republicans just wrapped a bruising end to the legislative year after Democrats repeatedly outmaneuvered GOP leaders and undercut the Republican agenda.
item.dc:creator: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Calen Razor, Mia McCarthy and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Congress leaves health mess for January
item.description: Congress is about to leave town for the holidays — and put off their health care troubles until January.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: Jack Smith jumps into a Judiciary minefield
item.dc:creator: By Hailey Fuchs, Calen Razor, Benjamin Guggenheim and Mia McCarthy
item.dc:contributor: By Hailey Fuchs, Calen Razor, Benjamin Guggenheim and Mia McCarthy

item.title: Parallel pushes for an 11th-hour health deal
item.description: Rank-and-file dealmakers in both chambers are making last-ditch attempts to extend key Obamacare subsidies this week, even as it becomes crystal clear the subsidies will expire first.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim

item.title: House GOP at the Obamacare cliff
item.description: House Republicans are set to mark their final session week of 2025 with a muddled health care message that’s poised to have a big impact — a nationwide spike in insurance costs after Obamacare subsidies expire in less than three weeks.
item.dc:creator: By Mia McCarthy and Calen Razor
item.dc:contributor: By Mia McCarthy and Calen Razor

item.title: Johnson’s next revolt: energy permitting
item.description: Speaker Mike Johnson is facing another intraparty revolt — one that has nothing to do with health care, defense policy or pay for college athletes.
item.dc:creator: By Emma Dumain, Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
item.dc:contributor: By Emma Dumain, Mia McCarthy, Calen Razor and Benjamin Guggenheim
